channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13708] PE - Add option to specify the range
item.description:
When specifying --rows=YYY for randomReads in PE, it will read YYY rows but only betweem 0 and YYY.

We might want to read YYY rows randomly between 0 and ZZZ.

YYY should only be the number of rows we want to ready. Not the high range.
item.summary: PE - Add option to specify the range

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Attached patch 'HBASE-13708-master_v1.patch' adds an additional 'rowRangeSize' option to PerformanceEvalutation. If rowRangeSize is specified when doing a random read test, PerformanceEvaluation will only read rows within this range. All other test types are unaffected by this new option.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12740895/HBASE-13708-master_v1.patch
against master branch at commit 04c25e0f355aaa6ded37b0477ce126a693756b81.

Attached 'PE_nomapred_output.txt' and 'PE_mapred_output.txt' are output files of Performance Evaluation random read runs for map reduce and non-map reduce with --rowRangeSize=100 & --rows=10.

Added extra logging to show that for random read's gets, even though rows < 10, it will randomly read rows between 0 and 100. Prior to patch would only read rows between 0 and 10.

Where is the logging Matt Warhaftig? I see

2015-08-14 07:24:27,013 INFO [TestClient-0] hbase.PerformanceEvaluation: Sampling 1 every 1 out of 10 total rows.

... I am in wrong place? Thanks.

The rowRangeSize is in the logging at the start with:

2015-08-14 07:24:25,523 INFO  [main] hbase.PerformanceEvaluation: RandomReadTest test run options={..."rowRangeSize":100...

And then at PE completion:

2015-08-14 07:24:27,148 INFO  [TestClient-0] hbase.PerformanceEvaluation: Finished class org.apache.hadoop.hbase.PerformanceEvaluation$RandomReadTest in 92ms at offset 0 for 10 rows from a range of 100 rows (0.11 MB/s)

The line you highlighted

2015-08-14 07:24:27,013 INFO [TestClient-0] hbase.PerformanceEvaluation: Sampling 1 every 1 out of 10 total rows.

is logging for sample sizing versus number of reads so 10 total rows is apt to display.

If you want rowRangeSize to be more prominent in the logging I can append it to that line.
